#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Charles Taylor gets 50 years for war crimes
#Text=Wednesday , May 30 , 2012
#Text=Charles Taylor
#Text=, the former President of Liberia , has been today handed a 50-year sentence for war crimes in neighbouring Sierra Leone .
#Text=The court previously held he financed a war which left an estimated 50,000 dead .
#Text=A school destroyed by RUF rebels .
#Text=Image : Laura Lartigue .
#Text=Taylor , 64 , is considered likely to remain incarcerated for life if the sentence stands , but his legal team has vowed to appeal .
#Text=The prosecution sought an 80-year sentence .
#Text=Taylor 's is the first conviction of a head of state by an international tribunal since the fallout from World War Two , when the Nuremberg trials were underway .

#Text=The Special Court for Sierra Leone , which is operating from the Netherlands to avoid unrest if Taylor were tried in Africa , spent more than a year deliberating before convicting Taylor last month .
#Text=Acquitted of ordering crimes or of acting in a joint enterprise to conduct them , he was nonetheless convicted of aiding and abetting the offences .
#Text=There were 94 prosecution witnesses and 21 for the defence .
#Text=The allegations date to civil war in Sierra Leone , which ran from 1991 to 2002 .
#Text=Taylor , who had been a warlord since the ' 80s , backed the rebel Revolutionary United Front ( RUF ) .
#Text=Taylor was elected Liberian president in 1997 after a different civil war concluded .
#Text=Six years later he was ousted when an arrest warrant was issued and fled to Nigeria .
#Text=He was arrested there in 2006 whilst again trying to flee and went on trial later that year .
#Text=Taylor , who had been facing a rebellion against him since 1999 in Liberia , received training from late Libyan ruler Colonel Muammar Gaddafi ' s regime .
#Text=Testimony included claims that Taylor-backed fighters adorned roads with human intestines and ate human flesh .
#Text=One claimed to have seen Taylor himself eat human liver , something Taylor denied .
#Text=One described asking RUF rebels to sever his only hand in exchange for his young son 's life .
#Text=Further allegations said teenage children were involved in the fighting and that Taylor sold illegally mined diamonds to finance arms purchases for the RUF .
#Text=Western celebrities Naomi Campbell , a model , and Mia Farrow , an actress , described an incident at a charity dinner held by Nelson Mandella , then South Africa ' s head , in 1997 .
#Text=Campbell and Farrow said Taylor gifted Campbell a number of diamonds .
#Text=Taylor is claimed to have ordered seizure of Sierra Leone 's diamond deposits by RUF soldiers .
#Text=It was claimed in court that child soldiers were used in conflict , as diamond mine guards , and to carry out amputations .
#Text=Allegations of forced amputation were made .
#Text=Taylor was convicted in late April of aiding and abetting forcing amputation , as well as rape , murder , child soldier recruitment , sexual slavery , and pillaging .
#Text=The court 's panel of judges , presided over by Judge Richard Lussick , heard a 30-minute address by Taylor at an earlier sentencing hearing .

#Text=" I express my sadness and sympathy for crimes suffered by individuals and families in Sierra Leone , " said Taylor , adding he acted " with honour " and as a peacemaker , asking for " reconciliation , not retribution " in sentencing .
#Text=Taylor also gave evidence at his own trial , spending seven months of testimony saying he strove for peace in the region .
#Text=Lussick noted the panel felt 80 years to be excessive given that Taylor was cleared of directly carrying out offences .
#Text=However , the court found other factors aggravated the case : In particular , he was a head of state .
#Text=" Leadership must be carried out by example by the prosecution of crimes , not the commission of crimes , " Lussick said in court .

#Text=" The special status of Mr. Taylor as a head of state puts him in a different category of offenders for the purpose of sentencing , " the judge said , with the convict " in a class of his own " .

#Text=" [ His ] positions both as president of Liberia and within the west African regional bodies distinguish him from any other individual that has appeared before this court , " Prosecutor Brenda Hollis said at a sentencing hearing .
#Text=" Taylor 's abuse of his authority and influence is especially egregious given that west African leaders repeatedly entrusted him with a role to facilitate peace .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Lussick also told the court today Taylor stood convicted of  aiding and abetting , as well as planning , some of the most heinous and brutal crimes recorded in human history " .

column1: #Text=At least one war crimes convict has been attacked in prison in the UK , and it is anticipated Taylor will end up in a high-security prison after the UK Foreign Office has promised to uphold an agreement to imprison him there made by ex-Foreign Secretary Margaret Beckett .

#Text=" The sentence is clearly excessive , clearly disproportionate to his circumstances , his age and his health and does not take into account the fact that he stepped down from office voluntarily , " said counsel for the accused Morris Anya .
#Text=The prosecution may also appeal the sentencing , and the verdict itself with intent to increase Taylor 's convictions beyond merely aiding and abetting .
#Text=The defence also intends to appeal the verdict .
#Text=The appeals process means Taylor is likely to remain at The Hague for several months , where the court has been holding sessions in nearby Leidschendam .
#Text=He is the last defendant to face trial before the Special Court , which has previously convicted and sentenced eight other prominent figures in the conflict .
